definition: criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours

sentences.english: Legend has it that there was a devil in Dynasty of Dong Han.
sentences.chinese: 相传，在东汉时期有一妖怪为祸人间。

sentences.english: Blessing from the security, disaster from illegal birth.
sentences.chinese: 福自安全来，祸从违章生。

sentences.english: Since security, disaster from illegal birth.
sentences.chinese: 福自安全来，祸从违章生。

sentences.english: All because of something as tiny as a mosquito.
Tom got a biff in the gut for his trouble.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆肚子上挨了一下，因为他惹了祸。

sentences.english: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites!
sentences.chinese: 你们这假冒为善的文士和法利赛人有祸了。

sentences.english: The tongue offends, and the ears get the cuffing.
sentences.chinese: 是嘴惹的祸，耳朵却挨了耳光。

sentences.english: "The downhills definitely took a toll, " he says.
See, I set before you this day life and prosperity, death and adversity.
sentences.chinese: 看呐，我今日将生与福，死与祸，陈明在你面前。

sentences.english: I don’t know what it’s going to bring, but no matter what good or bad happens, ultimately we win.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道将会有什么结果，是福是祸，我们最终取胜。

sentences.english: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!
sentences.chinese: 你们这假冒为善的文士和法利赛人有祸了。

sentences.english: Once the thought of a desire to win can stand, not evil.
sentences.chinese: 一朝之念不能忍，斗胜争强祸不小。

sentences.english: Fortune and misfortune are two baskets in a well.
sentences.chinese: 祸与祸是一个井里吊水的两个吊桶。

sentences.english: Fortune and misfortune are two baskets in a well.
sentences.chinese: 祸与祸是一个井里吊水的两个吊桶。

sentences.english: Woe to the disobedient, and death to cowards and unbelievers.
sentences.chinese: 不从命的人有祸了，懦夫与不信的人必遭死亡。

definition: to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
comet or supernova viewed as evil portent
criminal ringleader/chief culprit/fig. cause of a problem
